snippet: By raising their cash positions, mutual fund managers can help guard against any market fall — and save ammunition for buying again when stocks are cheaper.
abstract: Many mutual fund managers have quietly been raising their cash positions; by doing so, they can help guard against any market fall and save ammunition for buying again when stocks are cheaper; Morningstar reports average equity mutual fund held 9.7 percent in cash in latest quarter, up from 8.8 percent in previous quarter.
lead_paragraph: By raising their cash positions, mutual fund managers can help guard against any market fall — and save ammunition for buying again when stocks are cheaper.

headline.main: The Cash Cushion, Making a Comeback in Mutual Funds
headline.print_headline: The Cash Cushion, Making a Comeback
